Articles.Content:
[http://vestatrek.jpl.nasa.gov/](http://vestatrek.jpl.nasa.gov/)

The detail here is incredible. (There is a 3D mode, the guide will eventually turn it on and you can just ignore it after that.)

It is truly stunning how detailed the map of Vesta is.
Wow that is some detailed photos, I wonder if they will release one of Ceres

Yes, very cool, one thing I instantly reacted on is that it looks like Vesta has an mild degree of polar abnormality effect as we know from multiple bodies in KSP, Mun is most extreme and best known.

I know this is partily because the projecting and mapping together with shadows but an sure sign I have played too much KSP.
thank you so much for sharing this. The 3d mode is beautiful!

> 
> Yes, very cool, one thing I instantly reacted on is that it looks like Vesta has an mild degree of polar abnormality effect as we know from multiple bodies in KSP, Mun is most extreme and best known.
> I know this is partily because the projecting and mapping together with shadows but an sure sign I have played too much KSP.

It is exclusively because of the mapping procedure. Vesta doesn't have any polar abnormalities. Yes, you've played too much of it. ![:P](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_tongue.gif)

Wow, this page ever offers two hemisphere files for a 3D printer.
